required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise and GLP-1 RA on Insulin Secretion
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of 12 Weeks of Endurance Exercise Training Alone or in Combination With Glucagon Like Peptide 1 Receptor Agonist (GLP-1 RA) Treatment on Insulin Secretory Capacity in Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of endurance exercise on insulin secretory capacity, alone or in addition to treatment with the glucagon-like-peptide receptor agonist semaglutide, in patients with type 2 diabetes.

detailed_description.textblock:
The effects of endurance exercise alone or in addition to treatment with glucagon-like- peptide receptor agonists on insulin secretory capacity, will be determined in patients with type 2 diabetes.
Included patients will be randomized to either 12 weeks of endurance exercise training 3 times a week or therapeutical treatment with semaglutide for 3 months followed by 12 weeks of endurance exercise training 3 times a week. Insulin secretory capacity will be determined by hyperglycemic clamp method before and after.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline insulin secretion after Exercise intervention(12 weeks).
Change from baseline insulin secretion after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
Change from baseline insulin secretion after 3 months of combined exercise and therapeutic semaglutide treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after (3 days) Exercise intervention (12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
Before and after (2 days) Exercise intervention(12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Derived from hyperglycemic clamp and HOMA-IR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after (2 days) Exercise intervention (12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in baseline CTX, PNIP, Osteocalcin and alkaline phosphatase

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after (2 days) Exercise intervention (12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
Before and after (3 days) Exercise intervention (12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment
Before and after (3 days) Exercise intervention (12 weeks). Before and after 3 months of therapeutic semaglutide treatment

arm_group.description: 12 weeks of endurance exercise concomitant to semaglutide treatment

intervention.description: Ergometer cycling at 70 % of VO2 max, 45 minutes, 3 times a week
3 months of therapeutic treatment with semaglutide

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes
- BMI 28-35
- Moderately preserved insulin secretory capacity (determined by glucagon test)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insulin treatment
- Hypertension grade 3
- Heart disease
- Medical history with pancreatitis
- Diagnosed with neuropathy
- Excessive alcohol consumption
- Any condition that would interfere with the protocol.

facility.name: Xlab, Center for Healthy Aging, Department of Biomedical Sciences, University of Copenhagen
